content.question: Object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="m naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> travels to the right with a velocity <math alttext="v naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Object <math alttext="Y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="2 m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> moves to the left at <math alttext="2 v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure. The objects collide and then stick together. What is the change in kinetic energy of the two-object system from immediately before the collision to immediately after the collision?

choices.label: The kinetic energy increases by <math alttext="6 m sub 0, v sub 0 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mn>6</mn><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The kinetic energy increases by <math alttext="3 m sub 0, v sub 0 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The kinetic energy decreases by <math alttext="6 m sub 0, v sub 0 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The kinetic energy decreases by <math alttext="3 m sub 0, v sub 0 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The kinetic energy decreases by <math alttext="3 m sub 0, v sub 0 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
